SHOULD NOT DELAY TREATMENT

*If the diagnosis of adrenal insufficiency is unknown: blood cortisol and ACTH (and renin assay in children''') whatever the'''<nowiki/>'''it the'''<nowiki/>'''' hour, without waiting for the results''' to start treatment.
*If the diagnosis of adrenal insufficiency is known: None

Results :

*Positive diagnosis: low or collapsed cortisol levels,
*Etiological diagnosis:
**elevated ACTH: primary adrenal insufficiency,
**normal or low ACTH: corticotropic insufficiency.

question.title: When should treatment for adrenal insufficiency begin?
question.description: Based on the diagnostic information, what is the recommended course of action?

option_a.title: Delay treatment until the diagnosis is confirmed through laboratory tests.
option_a.description: Wait for blood cortisol and ACTH levels to be confirmed before starting treatment.

option_b.title: Immediately start treatment regardless of the diagnostic results.
option_b.description: Begin treatment without waiting for laboratory test results.

option_c.title: Only start treatment if the diagnosis of adrenal insufficiency is known.
option_c.description: Do not start treatment if the diagnosis is unknown.

option_d.title: Start treatment immediately, but only if the patient is experiencing symptoms.
option_d.description: Begin treatment as soon as symptoms are noticed, regardless of laboratory test results.

correct_option.title: Start treatment without delay
correct_option.description: Begin treatment immediately, regardless of the diagnostic results.
